column1: Hello Travelers, Tripadvisor has created this thread to be an ongoing resource for anyone seeking information about Coronavirus (Covid-19) and travel to Spain. Many travelers have already contributed to information about the Coronavirus, and we are hoping you will share any new updates or recommendations pertaining to Coronavirus in Spain here. Some of the information we’re seeing travelers seek out is: What attractions have been closed, or have re-opened for business?Are there any specific local resources for following news or other information? Have there been any significant disruptions to government services (such as public transport or airport/train stations)?What types of disruptions to local businesses have been noted?For more details on the situation globally please visit this Tripadvisor guide: https://www.tripadvisor.com/COVID-2019Additional threads with useful information that have already been started by our travelers can be found here:https://www.tripadvisor.com/Search…Please feel free to respond to this post with questions or information about this important issue, or share links to existing forum posts with useful information. As we at Tripadvisor, and more specifically our community of travelers have more information, please check back here to see how the situation is evolving in Spain. ColleenTripadvisor Content Team
No travel to Europe says Trump tonight
Very disappointing news all around.
Fairly sure you can travel to Europe, just not from it to USA. Although there's obviously a logistical issue there!

The government of Madrid has explained what they will not do - yet! It seems they are considering copying Lombardy - but not yet! However you get the feeling that could change. For anyone reading Spanish, you'll get the drift here (we fly to Madrid end of April, hoping to drive east after landing):https://elpais.com/sociedad/2020-03-11/madri…

This is a question for Tripadvisor. For those of us who cannot travel due to a govt advisory [CDC and State Dept in the US], can you help us with cancellations in terms of owners loosening cancellation fees? For others, re US travel ban from Europe to the US--there have been "clarifications" about what Trump meant when he announced the travel ban. As the previous poster pointed out, the ban applies to foreign nationals from [most of] Europe. [the UK is exempted, for example, having nothing to do with Brexit.]It does not apply to US citizens and permanent residents. I also agree there is a logistical problem in terms of airlines offering flights from Europe to the US--for non-Europeans only?

New actions being taken in light of exceeding 3000 cases--2nd to Italy in Europe.All schools are being closed plus other measures.you can translate this using google.https://elpais.com/sociedad/2020-03-12/notic…

Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez announced on Friday that the Cabinet would meet tomorrow and approve the implementation of a state of alarm in the country, for only the second time since Spain returned to democracy in the late 1970s.Read all about it herehttps://english.elpais.com/news/politics/
Update on Saturday from Governmenthttps:/…
Sevilla - Semana Santa processions have been suspended.
Hermanos y hermanas solidarios.
I have tickets for Alhambra booked for the 17th March. The place is closed. Will the tickets be refunded?
Wellington_blue go onto the Alhambra website & use the chat link - you will have to be patient as it may take a while to move up the queue.https://tickets.alhambra-patronato.es/en/

Tripadvisor Staff:I am repeating my earlier question. Will Tripadvisor assist us in asking owners to loosen their cancellation policies? Perhaps returning more, but not all of, our deposits? Offering credits for future use?If I have missed a posting on this please direct us to it.The recent email from the CEO of Tripadvisor said nothing about this.Thanks.
I was traveling to Spain from April 01-June09.I cancelled my reservation but the real state refuse to return my deposit and other charges. Where may I complaint..??
Airbnb and VRBO are helping with cancellation fees----Tripadvisor staff---please answer.

Barbara rather than posting on the Spain forum I suggest that you go to to the support contact pages where you can post a message to TA. https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/GeneralSupportChoose General site questions.Edited: 5:30 pm, March 14, 2020
Thanks Anniejou.I thought TA staff would monitor this thread because they created it. But I will follow your advice.

Will TripAdvisor follow Airbnb's lead and allow reschedule / refund of rentals. Owner of property in Barcelona is unwilling to reschedule and wants to keep the money. Obviously, with travel restrictions and such, we can't get there or leave if we were there.Thanks.
How can I cancel my Renfe tickets and Iberia tickets within Spain? They are all nonrefundable and non-changeable. Thanks!

sorry can't access other forum comments. not very techie. have had to cancel apartment in Seville, as all flights now cancelled. notified owner and cancelled on booking form. says i don't get a refund as due to go next week. due to circumstances will there be a refund? don't understand anything!!!!

We are due on Tues 16 March to drive from southern Spain to Bilbao to catch the ferry back to the UK. Does anyone know whether we are allowed on the roads at all (we are pretty sure that we are) and whether we can get a hotel stop on the journey?
Mo, were you flying from UK to Seville or from somewhere else in Spain? Where are "all flights canceled?" --RDC
kgkg - Renfe tickets will be cancelled & refunded if during the lockdown period.https:/…MedidasCV19.htmlIberia you will need to contact them - try via twitter.
Keep calm and stay at home

Hi, we were already in Spain when lockdown was announced at short notice. Fortunately (for the next 10 days) we have an apartment in Andalucia, but will need to think about getting back to the UK at some point after that.. We travelled down by car, so no idea if we will be allowed to travel through Spain and France. Foreign Office don’t seem to have much more advise to nationals already in Spain other than to consult local authorities.

Foreign Office in UK advice today:An FCO spokesperson said:“The Spanish government have confirmed that all hotels will close in Spain from Tuesday 24 March.“We therefore advise British travellers in Spain to contact their tour operator or airline as soon as possible, to arrange their return journey home before this date.”

The Spanish health ministry has reported 209 new deaths, bringing the total to 767, and a jump in infections by a quarter - from 13,716 to 17,147.The country has the fourth highest death toll in the world after China, Italy and Iran.The Spanish health ministry says 939 people are in intensive care while 1,107 people diagnosed with the virus have recovered.

My parents are Spanish residents (UK citizens) who were over in the U.K. when borders started to close. Their original and rescheduled flights were cancelled but I’ve got them on a British Airways flight back to Spain on Sunday.We’ve started to hear rumours that non-Spanish citizens might be refused entry. British Airways obviously has their passport details and hasn’t said anything, but is anyone able to offer any reassurance?They are currently staying with me but I’m an NHS worker who can’t self-isolate so I want them out of London!

The Spanish government wants to extend the state of alarm, declared on March 14 in a bid to slow the coronavirus outbreak, for another 15 days. Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez informed regional leaders of the decision during a teleconference on Sunday. The exceptional measure was approved by the Spanish Cabinet on March 14 and came into effect the following day. It was set to last until March 29. https://english.elpais.com/politics/2020-03-…
HiI am due to travel to Alicante on 25th April 2020.If I cannot get there by plane because of the restrictions, will I get my money back for the holiday rental booked with Holiday Lettings?

Go onto their website. I checked it earlier and I’m sure it saidIf you are due to start your holiday on or before 1st May You should contact the owner and ask to changeDate or you can get a refund with no penalty. I am goingTo wait until I know for sure flight has beenCancelled and that Spain Are not allowing anyone other thanSpanish to enter the country.
Thank you I have managed to cancel and I have advised I will get a full refund.

Hi Spanish friendsI saw the following video on Youtube I would like to sharehttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b5pAtEyS6qUWhere there is solidarity there is hopeStay strongEdited: 10:33 am, March 30, 2020

The quarantine "lock down" in Spain will continue to 26th April. As expected.
Cadiz-loverIs this a fact?

penrith1 until the government formerly give the go ahead, which could be any day soon, it is widely believed that to lift the lockdown now or at least when present one ends next week would be folly. Perhaps I jumped the gun having heard from reliable sources in Spain but I belive it will be extended.
Appears formal decision is now given go aheadhttps://english.elpais.com/politics/2020-04-…
Do you Think Costa Brava Region will open up before July, Am Travelling to Santa Suzanna on 1st July HOPEFULLY for my annual 2 week summer holiday. Can you advise Please

HelloHope all are staying safe. I had scheduled a trip to Spain during the Easter week which was cancelled. While most companies have been good about refunding the paid amounts, I am having a hard time with these 2:1. Ticketmaster: I had booked tickets for the Real Madrid match on April 12. Ticketmaster is saying they will not be able to issue refund until the National and European Football Association make a decision on refunds. I did not see anything in the news. Any update is much appreciated.2. Vueling: My flight from Barcelona was cancelled. Vueling says I can use the amount paid till December this year for a trip up to June 2021. However with travel remaining uncertain, I would like a refund. I called up their US phone line and it is impossible to reach a human being. The line cuts off when you choose that option. Has anybody had luck in getting a refund from Vueling?Many thanks.RegardsLaks
Hi booked hotel in Alicante September, I can cancel hotel free and get refund but would I be refunded the money they took for tax recovery charges and service fees.many thanks.
Hi ,has anyone had problems with hotels charging tax recovery charges and service fees.many thanks.

I cannot find any other threads on Alhambra tickets which have been purchased. We had booked for today May 2nd. The website says that our money will be refunded but we haven't seen anything yet. Unless it was in Spanish. Has anyone else got their ticket purchase refunded as it says on the Generalife website?
Money should be refunded into same  bank account you used (as far as I know)https://tickets.alhambra-patronato.es/en/
Today's El Pais explanation of the deescalation methodshttps://english.elpais.com/society/2020-05-0…

We are (were?) scheduled to fly from the U.S. to Portugal and then travel on to Spain (via public transit) in August. My understanding from a friend living in Madrid is that the border will be closed to tourists until at least October. Does anyone have a government source for that information? We are wondering if that's set in stone already. Can anyone advise? I don't speak Spanish, so I was hoping to find a site that had an English language translation option.Thanks for any help you can provide. (Chances are no one has definite answers about August, but I thought I'd ask just in case.)

Was wondering if anyone can comment on the possibility of travel to Spain and Portugal this summer (June and early July). We have flight and hotel reservations in place. Correspondence with these hotels shows us that about half are closed, and the others may or may not be ready. We're not even sure we will be able to enter Spain from the US via airline yet. Maybe late Summer?? or wait til next year?Joe
Latest extension newshttps://english.elpais.com/society/2020-05-1…

In Granada, Spain the situation as of today is that some bars are open (outdoor terraces) and more will be opening when we reach phase 2 (expected in 2 weeks)The Alhambra Palace is currently closed but is planning to reopen with new safety protocols. Expected end of May or beginning of June. (Estimation, not yet confirmed)The Spanish borders are closed at the moment but International tourists are expected to return from Mid June or July onwards. However the situation is not stable and depends greatly on the progress made. I will update again when we reach Phase 2Molly@piccavey
Latest. Spain opening to tourists https://english.elpais.com/politics/2020-05-…
The message is hoping that tourists from outside Spain can return in July. https://english.elpais.com/politics/2020-05-…

Hi. What is the understanding of “foreign tourists” that the PM Sánchez mentioned as being able to vacation in Spain from July ? Does it include non-Schengen citizens? I have not seen any details or interpretation . Anyone have any idea ?

#54 Sorry, it seems the Tourism Minister was contradicted by the Interior Minister. I asked TA to remove this post.

The current news carried by the "state" radio/tv service RTVE is that, after a morning of confusion with different departments of the central government in Madrid contradicting each other, the plan now is for the 2 main Spanish land borders, with France and with Portugal, to be open for tourists on 1st July.The issue of possible earlier openings for tourist flights to some of the Spanish islands remains unclear, however.(The other 2 land borders with Andorra and with Gibraltar have not been mentioned yet in these reports.)

Could anyone direct me to a government website that details the latest travel restrictions? Everything I seem to find doesn't outline who is/isn't allowed to travel. All I've been able to find is "Effective May 15 through June 30, passengers arriving in Spain from other countries will be required to quarantine at their home/place of accommodation for the 14 days immediately following their arrival" I'm having to show proof of restrictions to cancel an AirBnB stay in July (traveling from the US). From what I've read in the news. it sounds like Spain will not be allowing visitors from the US by then. Or is it a waiting game for the next set of restrictions to be announced?
The official date for reopening Spanish borders to foreign travelers is July 1, when it will also lift its requirement for a 14-day quarantinehttps://english.elpais.com/spanish_news/2020…

Hello all! Any idea when Spain is opening up for airline entry from the USA? The information online seems to indicate that travel into Spain via land borders will happen on July 1st, but no mention of access via international flights. Any information is greatly appreciated! Richard

Revulgo and everyone else, everything I've seen posted from the Spanish government indicates that international travel resumes for all countries on the 1st, and that the quarantine will be abolished. Are there more details forthcoming, or does it appear that Americans will be able to enter in July?

Thanks for all of the helpful info! My next question, for residents of Spain, is: will we be welcomed or unwanted as tourists? I hate to travel all the way to Spain only to find no one wants us there or we are making people feel nervous.Can anyone advise on the general feeling about allowing tourists? Also, should we assume that our hotels will be up and running since we haven't heard anything different, or do we need to reach out to all of them and make sure that everything is still good? I'm just wondering what everyone else is doing.We are still on the fence about the whole thing at this point...Thanks so much!

kievalina. Spain does want business activity to start again especially during the traditional hot holiday months of July and August. Tourists are of course generating much income for Spain and they miss visitors. As a frequent visitor to Spain I personally am quite nervous about the country having a second "spike" or wave of infections mainly brought about by the more relaxed open society that one sees in the summer. And again as a visitor it really depends on how you personally feel about the "new normal" and how it can affect your vacation. Think this terrible disease affects people in different ways so as an over 70s person I may be more concerned about exposing myself to danger. Whereas a teenager may not be as worried.

Latest news (June 14th):* Spain will reopen borders to European Union states on June 21.* From June 21, EU travelers arriving in the country will no longer be required to stay in quarantine for two weeks.* Travelers from non-EU countries will be permitted to enter from July 1, providing there is a reciprocal agreement on travel and taking into account the epidemiological situation in the country of origin.https://english.elpais.com/spanish_news/2020…* Here’s how the coronavirus deescalation plan will endhttps://english.elpais.com/society/2020-06-1…Edited: 1:48 pm, June 14, 2020

Please note that:* Tourists from the EU and the Schengen free-travel area – including the United Kingdom – will officially be allowed from June 21, with the exception of Portugal. And on July 1, other international travelers will be allowed to enter Spain as part of the EU’s coordinated move to lift travel restrictions. But this will be contingent on a reciprocal agreement and taking into account the epidemiological situation in the countries of origin, among other factors.* The United Kingdom is still considered an EU member state given that it is in a transition period and enjoys full membership rights, “this does not mean that there may not be another change if the epidemiological situation in Britain requires this.”* From July 1st, travelers will also have to complete a Passenger Location Card (PLC), which they must fill in with information about any coronavirus symptoms they might have, and their contact address during their stay in Spain. These forms, which are currently handed out, will be computerized to make the process faster and avoid large gatherings in airports. Similar measures have been included in the tourism scheme in the Balearic Islands.* From July 1, Spain’s airports will screen for potential coronavirus cases using thermal-imaging cameras, which can check the body temperature of several people simultaneously, an improvement from doing it one at a time with a thermometer pointed at a person’s forehead.* Informational posters have been placed in key areas of airports, and hand sanitizer dispensers, floor markers to indicate safe distances and protective screens have also been introduced. What’s more, reminders to wear face masks and keep apart from other travelers are emitted every five minutes over the airport loudspeakers.

Spanis Health Minister said that after Sunday, visitors entering Spain will have to undergo three types of controls: a written health declaration, a temperature check, and a visual screening. If travelers fail any of these tests, a physician will examine them and send them to the healthcare services of the region where they are going to spend their stay in Spain. In order to make these procedures smoother, airports are incorporating thermal imaging and digital declarations.https://english.elpais.com/spanish_news/2020…
@Molly S, thank you so much! We're scheduled to travel to Sevilla and Granada in November and want to figure out if we'll actually be able to see and do the things we have planned!

Lauren D - you can start your research for visiting the Alhambra by looking at the official websitehttps://tickets.alhambra-patronato.es/en/In fact you can also buy your entry tickets now if you like. Not that I would suggest you did because it's very early for November time.

I'm travelling to Spain for all of July on a road trip and wanted to know if the excursions in Spain are still open?These are the locations I'll be going to and i would like to do outdoor activities and excursions, scuba diving, rock climbing, horse riding, parties etc but there is no information indicating if these things are still open and you can book?ValenciaMadridCordobaSevelleCadizAlgecirasMalagaAlmeriaAlicanteValencia

I'm posting here as I am doing a 25 day road trip around Spain. I am hoping to be able to do activities and excursions such as scuba diving, rock climbing, wine tasting and parties. However, there is no information regarding if these things are still open and possible during Covid on tripadvisor as I dont wish to spend money and then it be cancelled. ValenciaMadridCordobaSevelleCadizAlgecirasMalagaAlmeriaAlicanteValenciaThese are the locations I will be travelling to. Any help would be greatly appreciated.
Can I travel to Spain from NYC as a UK citizen?
I would doubt it's the nationality that counts, more the residency. Wait and see if Spain opens its borders to the USA.

European borders are reopening, but there is a lot of small print to digestCitizens from the United Kingdom, which has officially left the EU but is still covered by a transition agreement until December that grants it full rights as a member state, can enter Spain. But anyone taking the opposite journey will have to quarantine for two weeks on arrival in the UK, a measure that will be in place at least until June 29, despite Spain having opted not to impose a reciprocal measure on UK arrivals.Denmark will keep border controls in place for the majority of its fellow members – including Spain – until June 27.The rules for non-EU and non-Schengen countries are yet to be defined at all. Spain is counting on the 27-member bloc to agree on a list of safe countries, with scaled entry dates according to the epidemiological situation in each one.Washington is still vetoing the entrance of Europeans on American soil, which is prompting the EU to respond in kind.https://english.elpais.com/spanish_news/2020…

Aragon goes back to phase 2. The Government of Aragon has announced this Monday that the Huesca districts of La Litera, Cinca Medio and Bajo Cinca are receding to phase 2 of de-escalation as a result of a resurgence of COVID-19 in the agricultural environment. This change will cause limitations to be re-established in these territories, such as a 50% capacity in the hospitality industry, a ban on the use of bar bars or a maximum occupancy of one third of the capacity of swimming pools. In addition, the Minister of Health, Sira Repollés, has recommended at a press conference to residents of the three regions to limit their movements abroad, as well as the rest of the population to avoid visiting the area.
Re-open European Union (Spain)https://reopen.europa.eu/en/map/ESP
Spanish airportshttps:/…1445454489247
Or this for Spanish airports AENAwww.aena.es/en/passengers/passengers.html

I just want to say thank you for all of your help. I'm saddened to say that we have had to cancel our trip (flights were cancelled by the airline), but knowing that Spain and Portugal are doing a better job of handling this crisis than the U.S. is, I'm trying to tell myself it's the right thing to do, anyway. Our group is from Michigan and New York, the only two states currently doing "well", but I know that even that is relative to the rest of the U.S., and that we are still not doing as well as you guys are at controlling this thing. I know that not having tourists from the U.S. will be an economic hardship for some, but I also know that this illness is not to be taken lightly, and I do think this ban is maybe for the best. If anything, Europe should be banning us because of our inability to deal with Covid19, but the result will hopefully be the same in terms of lives saved. I look forward to a time when we'll be able to visit. Everyone we have dealt with (with the exception of Ryanair-- I have NOTHING good to say about them!) has been nothing but understanding, polite, and kind, and it makes me even more determined to visit when it's safe to do so.Wishing you all the best. Take care, stay safe, and I hope you are all able to weather this. Again, thank you!

Can anyone comment yet on how hotel swimming pools are operating in practise? Thinking of booking a trip to one of the Islands but its not a holiday for my children if they can't comfortably use the pools. I've emailed a couple of major (5*) hotels and they can't seem to answer the question!

So after a token three weeks' quarantining returning holidaymakers or others arriving from Spain, the UK Government announces that it intends to make an announcement tomorrow to open or borders to them;https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-53199089
GOV.UK Foreign travel advicehttps:/…spain

New draft list of 15 countries that will be allowed to enter EU when borders open. There are two lists, one for those that will be accepted, and one for those who will not. The list has already aroused controversy after sources revealed that the United States - the worst-affected country worldwide by COVID-19 with more than 2.4 million cases, is on the latter list. The latest draft list of the countries for which Europe's borders will be open, and can confirm what we reported on Wednesday that Brazil, the US and Russia are indeed not on the approved list.

HiI'm thinking of booking a short trip end of July to Malaga. May I ask if the flights have been going ahead or being cancelled regularly? Airlines are publishinh fliggt dates and allowing to buy tickets but ive heard are then cancelling flights to and back closer to the travel dates,most not offering refunds? I would like to know for sure before I book and mist importantly because I don't want to get stranded. I won't have a car with me so I will not be able to drive to otger locations for flights back if they get cancelled.
Hi, Could anyone please tell me what hotels with buffet style restaurants are doing stop the spread of Covid19? Thanks in advance.

Hi LJDavies, there is no simple answer to your question as hotels and chains could be doing things differently. Some will be providing buffet style meals and others wont. Have a read at this hotels procedures for an idea of how things may work https://www.goldenhotels.com/en/covid19/ for better clarification you may be better asking in particular resort forums.
Thank you.

HiI have booked to drive to L'Escala in August. I have found a form to complete for entry into France on the DFDS and Eurotunnel websites https://assets.ctfassets.net/mivicpf5zews/4f…https://www.eurotunnel.com/Eurotunnel/files/…I've also got the link for when I return to the UK. For transit into Spain I cannot find a form. Hi Wilkies, the form for Spain can be found here https://www.spth.gob.es this can only be completed a few days before travel/entry into Spain so depending on the length of your drive, you may need internet access enroute.

Not as of yet but France is "watching the situation closely". Worth keeping an eye on continuously as things here in Spain tend to change quickly and with little to no warning especially if the government is involved.
hi, I am Canadian and plan to visit spain in September . do I need to be isolated for 14 days or any health form I have to fill out before the trip? where can I check those info? thank you.
Hi James, the health form that has to be completed can be found here - https://www.spth.gob.es I can't help with the other part re quarantine.
